Rulings.Edison:
●If there are no Archfiends on your side of the field, Falling Down is destroyed immediately, even in the middle of a chain.
●The Archfiend you need for Falling Down doesn't have to be a monster. Cards like Axe of Despair, or an Archfiend monster equipped to your Relinquished, will prevent Falling Down from being destroyed.
●You can activate Falling Down when there are no Archfiends on your side of the field, but it is destroyed immediately before it is equipped to a monster.
●You can't use Barrel Behind the Door against the damage from Falling Down because you can't use Barrel Behind the Door against a Continuous or Equip Spell Card.
Rulings.Tengu:
●If there are no Archfiends on your side of the field, Falling Down is destroyed immediately, even in the middle of a chain.
●The Archfiend you need for Falling Down doesn't have to be a monster. Cards like Axe of Despair, or an Archfiend monster equipped to your Relinquished, will prevent Falling Down from being destroyed.
●You can activate Falling Down when there are no Archfiends on your side of the field, but it is destroyed immediately before it is equipped to a monster.

Rulings.Goat:
●If there are no Archfiends on your side of the field, Falling Down is destroyed immediately, even in the middle of a chain.
●The Archfiend you need for Falling Down doesn't have to be a monster. Cards like Axe of Despair, or an Archfiend monster equipped to your Relinquished, will prevent Falling Down from being destroyed.
●You can activate Falling Down when there are no Archfiends on your side of the field, but it is destroyed immediately before it is equipped to a monster.
●You cannot use Barrel Behind the Door against the damage from Falling Down because you cannot use Barrel Behind the Door against a Continuous or Equip Spell Card.
●Q: Must you have an “Archfiend” monster on the field to activate Falling Down? 
A: If you control no face-up Archfiends on your side of the field, Falling Down will be destroyed by its own effect.  12 /19 /2003 
●Q: When “Falling Down” is destroyed, does the monster return to its previous controller? Would the 800 point damage also be finished? 
A: Control of the monster would revert to the previous controller. The Damage would also stop at that time.   
●Q: Can “Life Absorbing Machine” be used to gain back LP lost by the effect of “Falling Down”? 
A: Falling Down’s Effect is considered Damage. ”Life Absorbing Machine” cannot be used with this card's effect.  01/6/2004

Rulings.Base:
1. If there are no Archfiends on your side of the field, "Falling Down" is destroyed immediately, even in the middle of a chain.
2. The Archfiend you need for "Falling Down" doesn't have to be a monster. Cards like "Axe of Despair", or an Archfiend monster equipped to your "Relinquished", will prevent "Falling Down" from being destroyed.
3. You can activate "Falling Down" when there are no Archfiends on your side of the field, but it is destroyed immediately before it is equipped to a monster.
4. You cannot use "Barrel Behind the Door" against the damage from "Falling Down" because you cannot use "Barrel Behind the Door" against a Continuous or Equip Spell Card.
